bio.singa.structure.algorithms.superimposition

Class SubstructureSuperimposition

  • java.lang.Object
    • bio.singa.structure.algorithms.superimposition.SubstructureSuperimposition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Superimposition<LeafSubstructure<?>>

    public class SubstructureSuperimposition
extends java.lang.Object
implements Superimposition<LeafSubstructure<?>>
    An implementation of a Superimposition for AtomContainers.

      Returns the candidate that was used for this Superimposition.
      java.util.List<LeafSubstructure<?>> getMappedCandidate()
      Returns copied mapped candidates that were used to compute this superimposition, only containing the objects that were used to compute this superimposition.
      java.util.List<LeafSubstructure<?>> getMappedFullCandidate()
      Returns the full copied mapped candidates, which contain all objects of type T, regardless of the ones used to calculate this superimposition.

      • getStringRepresentation

        public java.lang.String getStringRepresentation()
        Returns a string representation of the SubstructureSuperimposition, that is: 
        [RMSD]_[PDB-ID of mapped candidates]_[candidate residues]...
        The ordering of LeafIdentifiers corresponds to the actual found optimal alignment to the reference. TODO move this to interface, as other superimpositions should also get a string representation.
        Returns:
        The full string representation of this SubstructureSuperimposition.

      • getMappedFullCandidate

        public java.util.List<LeafSubstructure<?>> getMappedFullCandidate()
        Description copied from interface: Superimposition
        Returns the full copied mapped candidates, which contain all objects of type T, regardless of the ones used to calculate this superimposition. The default method simply returns the mapped candidates as is.
        Specified by:
        getMappedFullCandidate in interface Superimposition<LeafSubstructure<?>>
        Returns:
        the candidates with their original objects that were used for superimposition
